refnamediv.refpurpose:
count
aggregates
count Returns a count of non-empty cells, or attributes that are not null.

refsynopsisdiv.synopsis:
AQL% SELECT count(attribute) FROM array GROUP BY dimension_1,dimension_2,...
AFL% aggregate(array,count(attribute),dimension_1,dimension_2,...)
AQL% SELECT count(*) FROM array GROUP BY dimension_1,dimension_2,...

refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: If you use the count(attribute) syntax, the count aggregate counts everything except the following:
If you use the count(*) syntax, the count aggregate returns a count of the all the cells present (both NULL and NOT NULL).

informalexample.para: This example finds the number of nonempty cells in a 3Ã—3 array.

step.para:
Create an array with values 1 along the diagonal of m3x3, and the remaining cells empty.
AFL% store(redimension (apply (build(<v:double>[i1=1:3,3,0,j1=1:3,3,0],1),i,iif(i1=j1,i1,null), j,iif(i1=j1,j1,null)), <v:double>[i=1:3,3,0,j=1:3,3,0]), m3x3); [ [(1),(),()], [(),(1),()], [(),(),(1)] ]

Find the number of nonempty cells in the array:
AFL% aggregate(m3x3,count(v)); [(3)]

informalexample.para: This example finds the number of nonempty and non-null cells from an array that contains some NULL values.

step.para:
Show the contents of array A:
[ [(),(),()], [(null),(null),(null)], [('a7'),('a8'),('a9')] ]

Count the number of nonempty cells:
AQL% SELECT count(*) FROM A; [(6)]

Count the number of nonempty and non-null cells for the value attribute, along the first dimension:
AQL% SELECT count(value) FROM A GROUP BY row; [(),(),(3)]
